parameters.name: query.subject.id
parameters.description: A concrete id of the subject.

parameters.name: query.subject.set.namespace
parameters.description:
The namespace of the object and relation
referenced in this subject set.

parameters.name: query.subject.set.object
parameters.description: The object selected by the subjects.

parameters.name: query.subject.set.relation
parameters.description: The relation to the object by the subjects.

parameters.name: expandMask
parameters.description:
Optional. The list of fields to expand in the RelationTuple
list returned in `ListRelationTuplesResponse`. Leaving this
field unspecified means all fields are expanded.

Available fields:
`object`, `relation`, `subject`,
`namespace`, `subject.id`, `subject.namespace`,
`subject.object`, `subject.relation`

parameters.name: snaptoken
parameters.description: Optional. The snapshot token for this read.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description:
Optional. The maximum number of RelationTuples to return in
the response.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description:
Optional. A pagination token returned from a previous call to
`ListRelationTuples` that indicates where the page should start
at.

ListRelationTuplesRequestQuery.description:
The query for listing relation tuples. Clients can
specify any optional field to partially filter for
specific relation tuples.

Example use cases:
 - object only: display a list of all ACLs of one object
 - relation only: get all groups that have members; e.g. get all directories that have content
 - object & relation: display all subjects that have e.g. write relation
 - subject & relation: display all groups a subject belongs to/display all objects a subject has access to
 - object & relation & subject: check whether the relation tuple already exists, before writing it

relationTuples.description:
The relation tuples matching the request query.

The RelationTuple list is ordered from the newest
RelationTuple to the oldest.

nextPageToken.description: The token required to paginate to the next page.

isLastPage.description:
Indicates if this is the last page of paginated data.
If `is_last_page` is true then using `next_page_token`
in subsequent requests will return an error.

namespace.description: The namespace this relation tuple lives in.

object.description:
The object related by this tuple.
Objects live within the namespace of the tuple.

relation.description: The relation between an Object and a Subject.

subject.description:
The subject related by this tuple.
A Subject either represents a concrete subject id or
a SubjectSet that expands to more Subjects.

v1alpha1RelationTuple.description:
RelationTuple relates an Object with a Subject.

While a tuple reflects a relationship between Object
and Subject, they do not completely define the effective ACLs.

id.description: A concrete id of the subject.

set.description:
A subject set that expands to more Subjects
(used for inheritance).

v1alpha1Subject.description:
Subject is either a concrete subject id or
a subject set expanding to more Subjects.

namespace.description:
The namespace of the object and relation
referenced in this subject set.

object.description: The object selected by the subjects.

relation.description: The relation to the object by the subjects.

v1alpha1SubjectSet.description:
SubjectSet refers to all subjects which have
the same `relation` to an `object`.
It is also used for inheritance.
